notesStmt.note: Transcribed from digital images contributed to the Internet Archive by the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign.

sourceDesc.bibl: Chicago Foreign Language Press Survey, 1936-1941, Works Projects Administration, Chicago Public Library Omnibus Project

revisionDesc.change: Initial TEI transcription from PanGeo Partners, Inc.

body.p: The Group "Einigkeit" held a well attended Agitation Meeting, at which several women also took part. Comrade Kiesling presided. The discourse about "Equal Rights" by Comrade Fehling was greatly acclaimed. Several new members were admitted, after which the meeting was adjourned till the next Agitation Meeting, May 5th.

Order of the day: lecture by Comrade Henley on "The Religion of the Christians" which promises to be very interesting. The comrades are requested to appear in large numbers. Bring your wives and friends with you.
New members will be admitted. Everybody is welcome, no admission charged.
